data:
Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Hello Myrcella,

 

It might be fairly difficult to find an apartment that you will like for that budget around here. Here are some things I found:

 

204 NW 17th St:

http://www.apartments.com/204-nw-17th-st-corvallis-or/9vk5zv5/

 

This apartment is really close to the north side of campus and looks pretty cool on the outside. I can’t speak for the inside but it seems alright.

 

Cinnamon Park Apartments:

http://www.apartments.com/cinnamon-park-apartments-corvallis-or/gqr8vrw/

 

This apartment is a bit above your budget and is a little ways away from campus in south Corvallis. If you were to move in here I would suggest a car or to be informed about the bus routes.

 

Thanks,

Henry Howard

 

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Friday, October 7, 2016 2:03 PM
To: Howard, Henry <Henry.Howard@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Housing... OMG!

 

Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

I like that closer one, Henry. Thanks for helping!

 

Myr

Sent: Friday, October 7, 2016 2:11 PM
To: Baratheon, Myrcella <Myrcella.Baratheon@oregonstate.edu>
Subject: RE:  Housing... OMG!

This apartment is really close to the north side of campus and looks pretty cool on the outside. I can’t speak for the inside but it seems alright.

 

Cinnamon Park Apartments:

http://www.apartments.com/cinnamon-park-apartments-corvallis-or/gqr8vrw/

 

This apartment is a bit above your budget and is a little ways away from campus in south Corvallis. If you were to move in here I would suggest a car or to be informed about the bus routes.

As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Hi!

 

There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Hello Myrcella,

 


According to weather.com it looks like it is going to be pretty cloudy and/or foggy this weekend. I think you should be fine without sunscreen. As for what to wear, the temperature is in the high 60s so I would bring a jacket.

 

Henry Howard

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Friday, October 7, 2016 2:12 PM
To: Howard, Henry <Henry.Howard@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Weather?

 

 

Hi!

 

There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Oregon is terrible! We could be in sunshine, back in California :( Thanks for figuring this out, Henry!

 

Myr

To: Baratheon, Myrcella <Myrcella.Baratheon@oregonstate.edu>

Hello Henry,

 

I am planning an event at my sorority this weekend and I could use some ideas for food to make as appetizers. I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!

 

Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Myrcella,

 

Here are some recipes I found. They are all listed to take under an hour. For recipes that include cheese make sure you get vegetarian cheeses:

 

Vegetarian:

http://www.realsimple.com/food-recipes/browse-all-recipes/provolone-roasted-pepper-crisps

http://allrecipes.com/recipe/26692/annies-fruit-salsa-and-cinnamon-chips/?internalSource=hub%20recipe&referringId=263&referringContentType=recipe%20hub&clickId=cardslot%2013

 

Vegetarian and gluten-free:

http://www.realsimple.com/food-recipes/browse-all-recipes/endive-ricotta-almonds-raisins

http://allrecipes.com/recipe/15184/mouth-watering-stuffed-mushrooms/?internalSource=hub%20recipe&referringId=263&referringContentType=recipe%20hub&clickId=cardslot%2014

 

They all look pretty good to me!

 

Henry Howard

 

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Friday, October 7, 2016 2:16 PM
To: Howard, Henry <Henry.Howard@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Awesome recipes

 

 

Hello Henry,

I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!

 

Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

So much comfort… my sisters will love me… and hate me too :)

 

Myr

Hello Henry,

 

Just a friendly reminder that I’ll need the following two books soon and you promised to help me buy them for a good price! :)

 

Please find them wherever you can, just make sure you will receive them by next week for classes. My budget is at most 200 dollars to get these two textbooks, but please please please try and find the best available prices.

 

Textbooks Needed:

Engineering Economic Analysis by Donald Newnan 12th edition IBSN: 978-0199339273

 

Robert Love, Linux Kernel Development 3/e, Addison-Wesley, 2010, ISBN: 978-1-672-32946-3

 

Email me back with where to buy them for the best price so they’ll arrive next week! I owe you lunch for this big help!

 

Thanks! :) :) :)

Myrcella

Myrcella,

 

You can get Engineering Economic Analysis on eBay here <http://www.ebay.com/itm/like/371753774008?vectorid=229466&lgeo=1&item=371753774008&rmvSB=true>  from Barnes & Noble for $79 and it should be delivered next week.

 

As for Linux Kernel Development you can get it here <https://www.abebooks.com/servlet/ShopBasket?ac=a&ik=19950596928&ir&xbf=b3MtcWctcGJhZ3JhZw__/64059802285803342171&clickid=Uzx0pvTf1wQMwNLT6GSGbxqhUkky8p1-0QwU3E0&cm_mmc=aff-_-ir-_-59145-_-96538&ref=imprad59145&afn_sr=impact>  for $15.19 to get it within 2 weeks.

 

Henry Howard

Hi, Henry ,
 
Game of Thrones season six is over and I really need something new to watch! I just don’t know what would be good. 
 
I’m a big fan of action dramas such as House of Cards and Homeland (all of which I’ve already seen, unfortunately). 
 
What’s the next best show after these three? I don’t want to be fooled into watching something bad, so please see if the critics agree that the show is really excellent. Some rankings would also help give me confidence the show will be worthwhile.
 
Thank you so much! 

Melisandre

Melisandre,

 

I haven’t seen it myself, but if you haven’t seen Breaking Bad is supposed to be one of the best shows of all time. It has a 9.5/10 on IMDb <http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0903747/> .

 

Henry Howard

 

From: Lannister, Melisandre [mailto:Melisandre.Lannister@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Friday, October 7, 2016 3:52 PM
To: Howard, Henry <Henry.Howard@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Best TV Show to Watch

 

Hi, Henry ,

 

Game of Thrones season six is over and I really need something new to watch! I just don’t know what would be good. 

 

I’m a big fan of action dramas such as House of Cards and Homeland (all of which I’ve already seen, unfortunately). 

 

What’s the next best show after these three? I don’t want to be fooled into watching something bad, so please see if the critics agree that the show is really excellent. Some rankings would also help give me confidence the show will be worthwhile.

 

Thank you so much! 


Melisandre

Hi there!
 
I need to buy a gift for a friend.
 
My friend loves the outdoors and the color pink.
She’s 22 years old and her birthday is in a week (7 days).
I will need something that will get here on time.
Nothing that will take too long to ship please.
 
I have 30 dollars to spend on my friend.
Please spend as close to that as you can.
 
Please email me the link(s) to the gift(s) you find and include how much they cost.
 
Thank you,
Melisandre

Melisandre,

 

Here is a pink sleeping bag for adults for $22.99 so your friend can sleep in style. You can get it by next Monday.

 

https://www.amazon.com/Lucky-Bums-Lightweight-Accessory-Compressing/dp/B00JG8HNI4/ref=sr_1_2?s=outdoor-recreation&ie=UTF8&qid=1475881471&sr=1-2&keywords=pink%2Bsleeping%2Bbag&refinements=p_n_feature_keywords_browse-bin%3A4746354011%2Cp_36%3A-3000&th=1&psc=1

 

Henry Howard

 

From: Lannister, Melisandre [mailto:Melisandre.Lannister@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Friday, October 7, 2016 4:03 PM
To: Howard, Henry <Henry.Howard@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Find a Gift for Someone

 

Hi there!

 

I need to buy a gift for a friend.

 

My friend loves the outdoors and the color pink.

She’s 22 years old and her birthday is in a week (7 days).

I will need something that will get here on time.

Nothing that will take too long to ship please.

 

I have 30 dollars to spend on my friend.

Please spend as close to that as you can.

 

Please email me the link(s) to the gift(s) you find and include how much they cost.

 

Thank you,

Melisandre

Henry,

Looks good! That's actually a pretty good deal for a full sleeping bag.

Melisandre

Hi there,

 

I heard from a friend that you are the one to talk to about this subject.

 

Unfortunately, my friend has to take two strong medications together - Adderall, and Valium. Are there any issues (contraindications) with taking them both together? Is there anything (food, activities, etc.) that he needs to avoid? I just want him to be safe. Please send a list of what you find, along with links to your resources.

 

Thanks for volunteering to check it out!

 

Davos

Davos,

 

According to the drug database at drugs.com these two drugs have no interactions when taken together. I would say that your friend should follow the recommendation of both drugs individually.

 

Henry Howard 

 

From: Stark, Davos 
Sent: Friday, October 7, 2016 4:19 PM
To: Howard, Henry <Henry.Howard@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  check on medication

I think I’ll tell my “friend” to check with a doctor first. 

 

Cheers,

D. Stark

Hello Henry,

 

I know graduating is coming up soon for you. It would be good to do a preliminary job search. Please find at least 1 job and send me an email with the link(s) to the job(s) you applied for. 

 

 

Here is the link for one job search site to get started. 

 

http://www.indeed.com 

 

Job criteria: 

 

You should find a computer engineering job. 

 

Must start after September 2016.

 

For now, just find one or more jobs you believe will work out well. We can talk about them further at our next meeting.

 

Sincerely, 

 

Davos

Davos,

 

Here is a job I found. It is with Intel for product engineering. It requires a degree in Computer Engineering.

 

http://www.indeed.com/cmp/Intel/jobs/Product-Engineer-d03f0c246701a94c?q=computer+engineer

 

Henry Howard

Hello Henry, 

 

I am your academic advisor. 

 

Below is a list of classes you must enroll in for Fall Term 2016 (yes, it’s actually still summer right now): 

 

ST 314 

PAC 201 

WR 121 

COMM 111 

H 100 

Note** Do not worry if there is no space in the class. I will make sure you get a spot in the class. 

 

In order to view the available times for these classes please use the OSU catalog <http://catalog.oregonstate.edu/Default.aspx?section=Course> . 

 

Please provide me with a list of the CRNs so that I can finish your registration process. 

Once you have been registered, I will provide you with the list of textbooks you will need for your classes. Since the textbook selection will be shared, we require all textbooks be acquired legally. 

 

Thank you, 

Professor Targaryen

Professor Targaryen,

 

Here are the CRNs that I have chosen.

 

ST 314: 20855

PAC 201: 10050

WR 121: 10106

COMM 111: Lecture - 13520

                         Recitation 10849

H 100: 15217

 

Thanks,

Henry Howard

Sent: Friday, October 7, 2016 2:35 PM

Subject:  Create an Ideal Class Schedule

Greetings, traveler,

 

I hear you’re are interested in exploring Eastern Europe with our group. Recently the group is wondering whether or not it is safe to travel right now. We need to do some research and see what we can find out.

 

The plan is to land in Istanbul. Next, we will be traveling to Sofia, the capital of Bulgaria.  After Sofia, the next step is some car travel to Macedonia and then onwards to Albania. Our last stop will be Tirana, in Albania.

 

The group would like to have some information sent to me to start this travel planning out:

 

A quick overview of each country’s political climate - I don’t want anyone getting into trouble and having this turn into some geopolitical affair! Is the country at war with a US ally? Is the country in political turmoil? Is there a US embassy? Is it safe to travel there now?

 

This will be a good start for the travel planning. Please research these items and send the information to me right away.

 

Kind regards,

Davos Stark

Eastern Reaches, an OSU Travel Group

Davos,

 

The US Department of State is warning travelers from the USA of increasing threats of terrorism in Turkey.

 

As for Sofia, the Department of State seems to be relatively clear except for warnings to watch out for thieves or scammers.

 

For Macedonia, there are warnings of crime in general, but not specifically targeted at Americans. The same is true about Albania.

 

Thanks,

Henry Howard

 

 

 

From: Stark, Davos 
Sent: Friday, October 7, 2016 4:11 PM
To: Howard, Henry <Henry.Howard@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  travel planning

 

Greetings, traveler,

 

I hear you’re are interested in exploring Eastern Europe with our group. Recently the group is wondering whether or not it is safe to travel right now. We need to do some research and see what we can find out.

 

The plan is to land in Istanbul. Next, we will be traveling to Sofia, the capital of Bulgaria.  After Sofia, the next step is some car travel to Macedonia and then onwards to Albania. Our last stop will be Tirana, in Albania.

 

The group would like to have some information sent to me to start this travel planning out:

 

A quick overview of each country’s political climate - I don’t want anyone getting into trouble and having this turn into some geopolitical affair! Is the country at war with a US ally? Is the country in political turmoil? Is there a US embassy? Is it safe to travel there now?

 

This will be a good start for the travel planning. Please research these items and send the information to me right away.

 

Kind regards,

Davos Stark

Eastern Reaches, an OSU Travel Group

Davos,

 

The US Department of State is warning travelers from the USA of increasing threats of terrorism in Turkey.

 

As for Sofia, the Department of State seems to be relatively clear except for warnings to watch out for thieves or scammers.

 

For Macedonia, there are warnings of crime in general, but not specifically targeted at Americans. The same is true about Albania.

 

Thanks,

Henry Howard
